en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
ny: Taiwan yakuza kuyambira pa tsiku la 15th, pamene ma sailor a Europe amapita pa nyanja amadziwa dzina la dziko lino kuti ndi Ilha Formosa, kapena dziko lalikulu.

en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
ny: Mwaka wa 1624, Kampuni ya Dutch East India inayozalisha bidhaa za Mashariki ya India ilianzisha kituo kusini magharibi mwa Taiwan, kuanzisha mabadiliko katika mazoea ya uzalishaji wa nafaka kwa wenyeji na kuajiri wafanyakazi wa Kichina kufanya kazi katika mashamba yake ya mpunga na sukari.

en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
ny: Mwaka wa 1683, mafunso a Qing dynasty (1644-1912) akhala ndi mphamvu yowonjezera ku madera a ku Taiwan ndi madera a ku kaskazini ndipo anayankha kuti Taiwan ndi mdera wa Dziko la Qing mu mwaka wa 1885.

en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
ny: Mwaka wa 1895, pambuyo pa kusinthidwa mu Chisino-Japan War (1894-1895), gawo la Qing linalandira Maukulu wa Shimonoseki, kuti lipeze chikondwerero pa Taiwan kwa Japan, yomwe ikhala ndi mphamvu ku dziko lino mpaka mwaka wa 1945.

en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
ny: Machu Picchu ndi dziko la m'manja mwa zochitika zosiyana, monga Intihuatana, Mtembo wa Dzulo, ndi Nyanja ya Mitala Yosiyanasiyana.

en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
ny: Zambiri mwa maboma a m'malo mwa dziko linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali linali

en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
ny: Mpaka 1976, asanu ndi ziwiri mwa Machu Picchu anayenera kusintha ndipo kusinthidwa kwa tsiku lino likuyenda.

en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, chidwi chachikulu cha kusintha mafoto amene amagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi 35mm, yomwe yayamba kugwiritsa ntchito kusintha kwa filimu pa nthawi ya filimu ya analogi.

en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
ny: Iyi ndi yomwe yachitidwa lero, koma zambiri zotsatira zake zinachitidwa ndi mfundo yomwe yachitidwa ndi mfundo ya mafoto a digitali.

en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
ny: Fomati ya 35mm ndi yabwino, koma ndi yabwino yomweyo, 36mm m'kati ndi 24mm m'makono.

en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
ny: Kukhala kwa mawonekedwe a format iyi (kugawira ndi ziwiri kuyambira kupanga mawonekedwe a bungwe la ziwiri) ndi chifukwa chake chikudziwitsidwa kuti ndi 3:2.

en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
ny: Zinthu zambiri zokwanira (m'malo mwa zinthu zina zokwanira, monga APS family of formats) ndi zokwanira kapena zokwanira zokwanira zomwezi zimakhala ndi mawuwo.

en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
ny: Kutali kwambiri ndi chifukwa cha chilungamo cha thiridzi ndi chifukwa cha kusankha kwambiri, ndipo ndi chifukwa cha kuyiwala kwambiri, ndi chilolezo chachikulu chokhala chifundo chokhala ndi chilolezo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chifundo chokhala chif

en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
ny: Iyi ikufuna kuti mpando wakale wokhala pa mphamvu yomweyo ndi pa kugwiritsa ntchito m'malo ophatikizira nyimbo kuchokera m'malo othandizira ndi m'malo osangalatsa (ona chithunzi).

en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
ny: Pamaso pa nthawi imeneyi ya tsiku la mafiko a Europe, Mpingo wa Katolika, wamene wapitilira kuyambira ndi wamkulu ndi wamphamvu, wapitilira kuthamangira.

en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
ny: Kwa zaka zambiri zotsatira, chikhristu chidapangira kuti mafumu a Europe akhale ndi chikhalidwe chomwecho komanso zofanana m'chilankhulo ndi zofunika.

en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
ny: Nzeru yonse yamene imakhala yamapangitsa munthu wamkulu mpaka wamphawi.

en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
ny: Mtsogoleri wamphamvu wa Khristu ndi kuti ndalama zidzikhala zikusintha chifukwa cha kusamalira kuyeretsa kuyeretsa ndi ukapolo ndi kuti ndalama zokhala zokhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala zikukhala

en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
ny: Utsogoleri wokhala wa mpingo uli ku Roma kwambiri kwa zaka zisanu ndipo chifukwa chake chidzachitika kuti anthu ambiri akhulupirire kuti khalidwe lomwe lili lomwe likhala lili lili.

en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
ny: Pano ndi pano pambuyo pa kuyenda kwa mafunso, Uingereza yachititsa msonkhano wa mafunso pa Ujerumani.

en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
ny: Makasitulutsa adakwanitsa, kuyambira kugwiritsa ntchito zinthu za m'malo mwa m'malangizo awo a m'malo mwa m'ziko zambiri, komanso kugwiritsa ntchito m'malo mwa malamulo a m'malo mwa m'malangizo a m'malo mwa m'ziko zambiri zilipo m'malo mwa m'zaka ziwiri zilipita.

en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
ny: Mwala wa Britain wakukonda madzi a m'manja a dziko lonse kuti asakweze ndege zonse zokhala m'manja a madzi, chifukwa cha kusintha mtima kwa ndege zina zokhala m'manja a madzi.

en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
ny: Chifukwa chokhala ndi mphamvu yochepa kwa tsiku lino, Ujerumani yayimba kusankha mphamvu yomweyo pa mphamvu yake ya kusankha yomweyo.

en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
ny: Pamaso pa 1920, zilizonse za anthu ndi mafumu amene anali ndi chikhulupiriro cha kusintha ndi kuchepetsa.

en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
ny: Pambuyo pa kuona zomwe zinali zopanda nzeru ndi zopanda chisoni za chiwonetsero chachikulu pa Dziko la Kukhala pa Dziko la 1, anthu a dziko lapadera anayembekezera kuchepetsa chithandizo chachikulu chifukwa cha nthawi yabwino.

en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
ny: Mwaka wa 1884, Tesla anayamba ku United States of America kuti apange kazi ndi Edison Company mu New York City.

en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
ny: Iye anafika ku US ndi ma cents awiri ndi kusintha kwake, buku la zolaula, ndi mawu a chilolezo kwa Charles Batchelor (menejeri wake mu ntchito yake yachipatala) kwa Thomas Edison.

en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
ny: Ku China yachipembedzo, palibe chilichonse chachikulu chomwe chinachitika chifukwa cha nthawi zina; nthawi zonse za China kapena kumudzi yomwe yayamba ndi mphamvu yayikulu ya chisankho chinali chidzukulu cha dziko.

en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
ny: Pali pano pakati pa dziko lonse, pali nthawi yosowa chitetezo m'maiko akugawana. M'maiko ake omwe amakhazikika ndi nthawi ya M'maiko Atatu, yomwe yakhala kwa 60 ndi m'maiko a Han ndi Jin.

en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
ny: Pamaso pano, kulibe mphamvu yowawa yowawa yomwe yachitika pa anthu ambiri a mafumu akupambana kuti apange kugwira ntchito ya mfumu.

en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
ny: Mipingo Yathatu ndi m'maiko a China aja anali m'malo osauka kwambiri mu nthawi ya kale, anthu amaphedwa ndi kuyambira kupambana kuti asithe mu mphamvu yochokera mu dziko lalikulu la Xi'an.

en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
ny: Pali zambiri za maphunziro ndi zinthu za m'malo motero ndi zinthu zosiyana monga kusintha kwa mfundo yamalangizo, kusintha kwa kudzera kwa chikhalidwe kuchokera ku ukapolo, kudzera kwa dziko ndi chikondi chomwe dziko likugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi anthu osati mtsogoleri wamkulu wamkulu.

en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
ny: Pambuyo pake, mabungwe a maphunziro anapangidwa kwa onse omwe ali ndi mphamvu zambiri, kupereka mphamvu zambiri kwa onse omwe ali ndi mphamvu zambiri.

en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
ny: Zosiyana ndi mafunso a m'malungo chifukwa chifukwa pamaso pa kusintha kwa mafunso a armi amene amakhala ndi mafunso a kusintha.

en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
ny: Utsogoleri wa Ufaransa wapambana ndi kusintha kwambiri anthu ambiri a mphamvu ya kugwiritsa ntchito amene ali m'malawi ena kuti azachitse mapindu awo.

en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
ny: Muhammad anali wokondwera kwambiri mu zinthu zomwe zili pansi pa moyo wonse. Analibe kugwira ntchito m'mbuzi yomwe yachitika ku Mtsinje wa "Noor" (mtendere) kwa kuyang'ana.

en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
ny: M'mbwe yomweyo, yomwe yalimbikitsidwa ndi nthawi, ikhala ndi chithunzi chabwino cha zochitika za Muhammad's zomwe zikuchitika.

en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
ny: Kukhala pa mphamvu ya mtsinje wina wakakamiza Mecca, kholo likugwiritsidwa ntchito yake yonse pa dziko lonse.

en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, kodi ndi zochitika kusiyana ndi kusankha ngati munthu amadziwa kuti ili ndiye? Pambuyo pa kuyenda mu mgodi, ndi chilungamo chonse.

en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ny: Palibe chomwe chingathe kuchitika ngati m'mwamba wabwino wosatha ndi maboma ambiri otsatsa. Kuchokera m'mwambamo, palibe chomwe chingathe kuoneka kapena kusintha.

en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
ny: Pyramid yochokera ku Giza ndi yowonjezera yowonjezera yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe yomwe y

en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
ny: Yagwirizidwa ndi aMisiriyu mu tsiku la tatu la BCE, Pyramidi Yabwino ndi mochedwa wa mafano ambiri a pyramidi zokoma zogwirizana ndi kusankha Pharaoh wamwalira.

en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
ny: Mtsinje wa Giza, kapena "Mtsinje wa Giza Necropolis" mu Mtsinje wa Misiri wa M'mtendere wam'mwamba umakhala ndi mitsinje yambiri (yomwe mtsinje wam'mwamba ndi wam'mwamba), mitsinje yambiri yochepa, mitembo yambiri, ndi Mtsinje wam'mwamba.

en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
ny: Makalata akulu akhala yachitidwa kuti ikhale chifundo kwa Pharaoh Khufu, ndipo makalata amitundu yosiyanasiyana, m'makalata, ndi maboma akhala yachitidwa kuti ikhale chifundo kwa akazi ndi anthu a m'mbuyo a Khufu.

en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
ny: Mau a "up bow" amapangitsa ngati V ndipo mau a "down bow" amapangitsa ngati chigawo kapena mawiri akugwiritsidwa kusowa kwa m'malo mwawo.

en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
ny: Kuwotchera kudzera kudzera kuti udzatsegule pa chikwama ndipo kudzala kuti udzatsegule pa mpingo (kuti ndi kumanga mkono wako) ndipo udzatseke chikwama.

en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
ny: Mfumu Louis XVI wokondwa, Mfumu Marie Antoinette ndi ana awo awiri a m'modzi (Marie Therese wamkulu wamaka 11 ndi Louis-Charles wamaka 4) ndi mdzukulu wa Mfumu, Madam Elizabeth, pa 6 October 1789 anaphwanya kuchoka Versailles ku Paris ndi anthu a m'masewera.

en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
ny: Mu galimoto, anapita kumudzi wa Paris wokhala ndi anthu ambiri amene amakhalira ndi kusankha ndi kusankha mawu akumudzi ndi kusankha mawu akumudzi akudziwa Mfumu ndi Mfumu.

en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.

en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.

en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
ny: Kusinthidwa kwa zinthu za teknoloji ndi nkhani yomwe ikugwiritsa ntchito zinthu zambiri m'malo motero, kuchokera ku kusinthidwa kwa teknoloji kapena kusinthidwa kwa zinthu za teknoloji mpaka kusinthidwa kwambiri kuti chitukuko cha anthu chidzatha ndi chidzakhala chifukwa cha chilolezo chomwe chidzakhala chikugwiritsidwa ntchito ndi mafunso a sayentifikoli ndi kusinthidwa kwake mwa teknoloji.

en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
ny: Zambiri zokhazokha za kusintha kwa zida zikuyendera mawonekedwe awiri ambiri: kuti kusintha kwa zida ndi chitsanzo chachikulu chosintha kwambiri kuposa chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chilengedwe cha kusintha kwa zida ndi chil

en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
ny: Pamaso pake, munthu angayankhe kuti mota yomweyo imachitira ntchito kuyambira kumalengedwa kwamitengo.

en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
ny: Koma, mwayi wa maphunziro a manda a dziko lonse si wofanana ndi kusintha mafuta a magalimoto ochepa, chifukwa chake mwayi watsopano wakuwonjezera kuti magalimoto azipita ndi chilolezo.

en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
ny: Kulowa kwa magalimoto ambiri kumachitira kuti kulandira zambiri za mavuto pa mitsinje, zomwe zimachitira kuti kulandira zinthu zatsopano mu zofunikira za kusintha mafupa omwe akuthandizira kudzaza mavuto.

en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
ny: Utsogoleri waukulu wa chikhalidwe cha kuchita zinthu ndi chikhalidwe cha kudzera kwa anthu, chidzachokera kwa atumiki ngati Goethe, Fichte, ndi Schlegel.

en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
ny: M'mbali ya Romanticism, dziko linalinga anthu, ndi ndalama zina zokhudza ndi zofunika zokhudza dziko lino, ndipo izi, zikuyenda ndi kusintha ndi dziko la m'mtundu, zinali bwino kuposa malamulo otsatira.

en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
ny: M'mene Paris ili ndi dziko la fashoni la dziko la dziko la dziko, Constantinople ili chifukwa cha dziko la fashoni la dziko la dziko la feudal Europe.

en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
ny: Kuyambira kwake kwa kuchokera ndi kuyambira m'ma 400 A.D. ndi kuyamba mpaka m'ma 1100 A.D.

en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
ny: Chidzidzi chake chachitika pa tsiku la 12 ndi chifukwa chake anthu a Crusaders anabweretsa zinthu zomwe zinakhala zikuchitika monga mafuta ndi mafuta omwe ankachita kugwiritsa ntchito kuchokera ku masoko a Byzantine.

en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
ny: Pano ndi nthawi imeneyi yomwe kugwiritsa ntchito dzina la Fashion Capital kuchokera ku Constantinople kwa Paris.

en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
ny: Ntchito ya chidzimayiko cha Gothic yachitika mu nthawi ya tsiku la 10 - 11 ndi la 14.

en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
ny: Pa nthawi yochuluka, mavuto amagwirizana ndi chikhalidwe cha Byzantine ku dziko la m'mwera.

en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
ny: Koma, chifukwa cha mabwalo a komunikeshoni a choncho, zofunika ku maganizo ku m'mwera zimenezi zingathe kudzakhala zimene zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zikudzakhala zik

en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ny: Pakati pa mawu a Mabedi a Mzaka wa Kati, kuwachuluka kwa maphunziro a kuwachitira zinthu zao ndi mtundu wawo wa kuchitira. Maphunziro a maphunziro a maphunziro a Crusades anawachitira anthu kuti atumize maphunziro kuti atumize zinthu.

en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
ny: Kilimo cha kuishi ni kilimo kinachofanywa kwa ajili ya uzalishaji wa chakula cha kutosha kukidhi mahitaji ya mkulima na familia yake tu.

en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
ny: Kilimo cha kujikimu ni mfumo rahisi, mara nyingi wa kikaboni, unaotumia mbegu zilizohifadhiwa za asili za eneo la ikolojia zilizochanganywa na mzunguko wa mazao au mbinu nyingine rahisi kwa lengo la kuongeza mavuno.

en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
ny: Pa nthawi zambiri, anthu ambiri amabwera ndi zinthu zokhazokha mu chuma ndipo izi ndi zofunikira m'malo mokhazokha mu dziko lalikulu.

en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
ny: Maboma akhoza kusintha anthu omwe ali ndi chikondi chofanana amene amadziwa kuti ali ndi chilungamo cha m'malo mwa maphunziro a m'malawi ndipo akawatulutsa kuti aphunzitse mtima wawo.

en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
ny: Zikakumana zingaonekere chifukwa cha umri, ukhali, mtsogoleri, dziko, kapena chinsinsi cha anthu.

en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
ny: Zinthu zomwe zidzakhazikitsa chikhalidwe chokhazikika ndi chikhalidwe chachikulu zingakhale zokhazikika, zokhazikika, zokhazikika, zokhazikika, zokhazikika, zokhazikika, kapena zingakhale zokhazikika zosavuta.

en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
ny: Abale a m'chitumbuka akhoza kusankha kusintha kwa mafunso awo ndi kusewera kwawo mwa ntchito yoyenera ndi kusintha, yomwe ikuchokera mwa mavuto, mabwerera, ndi zolankhula.

en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
ny: Mphamvu yowonjezera kusamalira kwa kusintha m'mene anthu amasamalira ndi kusunga m'mene zikuyenera kusamaliridwa ndi kupangidwa kuti ikhale ndi zaka zikuyenera ndi kusamalira ndi anthu yowonjezera ndi kusunga m'mene zikuyenera kusamaliridwa ndi kupangidwa kuti ikhale ndi zaka zikuyenera ndi kusamalira ndi anthu.

en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
ny: Ana ake amene akuyenera kuchitidwa "feral" kapena wamphamvu. Ena kwa ana ake amene akuchitidwa feral anaphunziridwa ndi anthu (m'malo mwa awo abambo awo); m'malo mwa ziwiri, kuchitidwa kwa ana ake kuli ndi chifukwa cha kukhulupirika kwa abambo awo pa chilango cha kugwira ntchito kapena kugwira ntchito.

en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
ny: Ana a m'manja angathe kukhala ndi kusintha kwa mwanakazi kapena kusowa mtima kabwino ngati anapulumuka kapena kudzuka.

en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
ny: Ena amati ali ndi chikhulupiriro choti anabweredwa ndi malo; ena amati anabweredwa kumwamba ndiwo ndiwo.

en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
ny: Pamene akhala wapatsidwa ndi anthu osalengedwa, mwana woyipa amapereka mawu (pamodzi ndi mphamvu za m'malo ake) monga zimene zimakhala zokhala kwa munthu woyipa, monga kusowa kwake kapena kusamala kwa anthu.

en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
ny: Pamene kusintha kwa mafunso wokhala ndi chithandizo cha ntchito, kusintha kwa mafunso kumapereka chithandizo chabwino zaidi.

en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito kwa anthu amene akuyenda maphunziro amene akufuna kugwiritsa ntchito, koma ndi chithandizo chimene chikugwiritsa ntchito kwa anthu amene akuyenda maphunziro amene akufuna kugwiritsa ntchito, monga kugwiritsa ntchito programu yatsopano ya kompyuta kapena kuyamba phunziro latsopano.

en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
ny: Mabwalo angathe kupita ndi mawu ake ndi mawu, ndi zina, mwalimu ndi mawu a mabwalo koma ndiye ndi mawu a mabwalo a Microsoft Office.

en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
ny: Mabango a Virtual Scaffolds amalowa m'makina ndipo amakhala opanga mafunso, kusintha, ndi kulemba zomwe zimakhala zopangidwa, zomwe zingathe kugwiritsa ntchito munthu wamkulu.

en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
ny: Ana ndi ana amaperekedwa m'mtundu wabwino wa chikondi chifukwa cha zinthu zambiri zomwe zimachitika, zomwe zimachokera ku kusowa, kuchita kukhala, ndi kuchita kugwiritsa ntchito.

en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
ny: Palibe mwana amene akufuna kuyamba kugwira ntchito mu mndandanda wosamvera, wosamvera ndi wosamalipira, koma amapanga.

en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
ny: Tidziwika mfundo ya Foster Care System kuti ndi chikumbumtima chokhala pa ana amenewa.

en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
ny: Mfundo yathu ya kudzaza m'maboma amathandiza kusungira m'maboma amapereka makasitomala amakonda, kusintha kwa masomphenya, ndi kusintha kwa zikoli zoyenera.

en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
ny: Kukhala m'nyumba ya m'mbale yomwe anaphedwa kumene kuli chilichonse chomwe sanali nacho, ndi chifukwa cha kuwathandiza.

en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
ny: Internet ili ndi zinthu zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zomwe zimakhala zokhazokha zom

en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
ny: Zinthu zosiyana zazinthu za Internet zimapezeka m'malo omwe amapereka mwayi wa ntchito ndi zinthu zambiri m'malo omwe amapereka mwayi wa ntchito.

en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
ny: Mwachitsanzo, "kuyendetsa" ndi "kuyang'anira" zikuyenera kusinthidwa ngati mabvuto ambiri a kusintha kwa Intaneti (James et al., 1995).

en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
ny: "Kugwirizana pa nthawi ya munthu" ndi "kugwirizana pa nthawi zina" anali mwa maudindo amaphatikizidwa ndi Eighmey ndi McCord (1998) pamene analandira maudindo a anthu kwa mawonetsa.

en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
ny: Nkhani ya kusunga vidio yachitetezo yafika ku zidziwitso zofunikira mu kusankha zofunikira, zokhala za mawu a mawu amene amatha kusintha m'mawa ochuluka.

en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
ny: M'mene mungati, kuyambira pachifukwa chake, munthu angathe kuchita kudziwa kuti ali ndi chisoni chifukwa cha kuchita kudziwa zinthu zopanda mzeru.

en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
ny: Oliver Sacks, mu papaya yake ya The President's Speech, anayankhula ngati anthu amene sadziwa kudziwa zokhazokha chifukwa cha kudzaza mafuta a mtima amatha kudziwa chilungamo.

en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ny: Iye amachitira chidwi kuti mphamvu zomwezi zokonza kuchita ntchito yomweyi mu kudziwa mawu a anthu zingathe kusangalala ndi m'manja mwa mbewu zomwe zimakhala zikuchitika ngati mbewu zokhazikika.

en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
ny: Makasitasi a mawa a chaka cha 20 zinali zonse zinachitika kuti kuli mizimu yachiwiri ya chilengedwe cha mafuta: yomwe ikupambana ndi yomwe ikuyenera kuchitidwa.

en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
ny: Kusintha kwa mafuta kuchokera kwa mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta amapereka mafuta

en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
ny: Kukhala ndi kugwirizana kwa m'manja ndi kugwirizana kwa m'manja kumagwiritsa ntchito mawonekedwe kuchokera m'manja awiri ndi m'manja awiri ndi kumene kumachitika kwa mtsinje wachikhalidwe.

en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
ny: Pa savanna, ndi zokonda kwa munthu wamkulu ndi maziko ake a mafuta kuti adzipeza zokonda zake za amino-acid kuchokera kumapulani a m'mabuku a m'maiko.

en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
ny: Pali pano, kugwirizana ndi zimenezi kuli zinthu zoposa: kusowa kukula, kudya zosowa, ndi kufa m'malo mwake.

en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
ny: Zinthu zambiri zopita ndi zokhala zimene zinawonekera zoposa zinthu zina zimene zinagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi mafuta a zinthu ndi mafuta a mafuta, koma zimenezi ndi zopanda mwayi kwa anthu ngati ife kuti tizikwaniritsa, chifukwa chake zimenezi zikuyenda.

en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
ny: Pa chinsinsi, zinthu zokwera (nyenyezi, nyenyezi, manda) sindingathe kugwiritsa ntchito, koma zimandipatsa zinthu zopanda mwayi zomwe zikugwiritsa ntchito zonse zomwe zikugwiritsa ntchito.

en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
ny: Zonse zimene zikuchitikazi, sitipindulire kuti tizitiwona ngati awo amene anaphunzirira kupeza chakudya chawo cha "protein" m'malo mofanana ndi zomwe a nyani ku savanna amachita lero.

en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
ny: Kukhala ndi mawu amene akupweteka ndi kusintha kwa kugwiritsa ntchito kwa nthawi yanu ya kugona yamakono ndi kugona bwino m'mawa wachinsinsi (10-60 mphindi).

en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
ny: Izi zingathe kuchitika ndi kusankha mawu a chikhalidwe chokhala chonse ndi kukufufuza koma osaonetsa kukufuka bwino.

en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
ny: Ngati mukufuna kukweza saa m'mtima wanu m'msonkhano, inu mungapeze m'malo omwe wina wakumaliza, kuyambira kuti mukhale mukukhala m'mtunda kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti mukalowe kuti m

en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
ny: Zina zina zomwe zimatha kugwira ntchito zomwe zimakhala zokhala ndi madzi olimba (koma madzi kapena chayi, zimene zimakhala ndi ntchito ya kusintha madzi), pamaso pa kulala, kusintha munthu kuti azikwera kugwira ntchito.

en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
ny: Kusintha kwa chitsimikizo cha munthu ndi chikhalidwe chachikhalidwe chikukhala chokhala ndi kusintha kwa chikhalidwe chachikhalidwe chokhala ndi chikhalidwe cha mtima ndi moyo.

en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
ny: Ntchito yophweka, ntchito yambiri yomweyi yomweyo. Mwini woyamba ali ndi mphamvu ya moyo yomweyi ndiye ali ndi mphamvu yomweyi yomweyo. Onse wina ali ndi mphamvu yomweyo kuti alemekezeke ndi kusintha.

en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.

en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
ny: Budismo wa Tibet ndi wokhala pa mawu a Buddha, koma wapulumutsidwa ndi njira ya mahayana ya chikondi ndi ndi zambiri zambiri zomwe zinatuluka kuchokera ku Yoga ya India.

en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
ny: Mwa mphamvu, Budismo la Tibet ndi loyera kwambiri. Lili ndi Kundalini Yoga, kuyeretsa ndi njira yonse ya chikondi chachikulu.

en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
ny: Ndikofuna Yoga ndi Kundalini, nkhondo ya Kundalini (nkhondo ya kusintha) ikukhala yatsika ndi mafunso a yoga, kusintha kwa mafunso, mantras ndi mafananizo.

en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
ny: Tsiku lalikulu la chikhulupiriro cha Tibet ndi Deity Yoga. Pamtanda wa mafano a anthu awo, mizere yamapazi yadzaza, mafunso amapangidwa ndi kuchititsa ntchito chikhulupiriro cha kusintha.

en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
ny: Germany anali dziko la mphamvu lomwe mu Dziko la Dziko la 2, kuchokera kwa kusintha kwa mphamvu kati ya USSR ndi USA. Pambuyo pa kusintha kwa dziko, maphunziro ndi ntchito zinachitika ndipo dziko zinagwirizana.

en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
ny: Ndikumakondweretsa ndi zaka ziwiri zokhala pa mpando, anthu omwe ankakhala akumana anakhala anthu akale ndipo mpando waukulu wachokera.

en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ny: Iyo ndiyo yomwe idzakhala mpaka mawa ndi mabwana 40 ndipo idzakhala yomwe idzakhala yachitikira mwa anthu ochokera m'malo mogwirizana, m'ma bwalo a chitukuko kuchokera m'mbali yonse ya Afrika kuyenda ku Asia, m'mbali ya Afghanistan, Cuba ndi zina zambiri.

en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
ny: Mpaka September 17, 1939, chigawo cha Polandi chinali chakuchepa, ndipo chiyambi chachilendo chinali kuchita kukhala kudzudzula ndi kusintha m'malo mwa mtsinje wa Romania.

en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
ny: Koma, mabvuto amenewo anachititsa kulephera kuyambira tsiku limodzi, pamene zaka zaka 800,000 zikulu zomwe zinayamba kuchokera ku Armia Yosovieti ya Red Union zinayamba kuyamba ndi kuyambira m'maiko a dziko la Belarusi ndi Ukraine pamene zinayamba kuchokera m'maiko a dziko la Poland m'maiko a dziko la m'maiko a Riga, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti, Pakuti,

en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
ny: Kusankha mafuta kuti azipeze zinthu ndi njira yomweyi yopanga kusankha anthu ambiri ndi zinthu m'nyanja ndi yabwino kwambiri.

en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
ny: Ntchito ya mabvuto a navy yakhala kuyambira kusintha kuti dziko lanu lichite kugwira ntchito kuti anthu anu ndi zinthu zanu zikhale zikugwira ntchito, pamene pali nthawi yomwe, kuyambira kusintha kuti dziko lanu lichite kugwira ntchito kuti anthu ake ndi zinthu zake zikhale zikugwira ntchito.

en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
ny: Mwachimwana wamkulu wokhala ndi zochitika zokhazikika zambiri zomwe zinachitika pamene zimenezi zinakhala kampani ya Atlantiki ya Kaskazini ya Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la Dziko la

en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
ny: Pa nthawi yomweyo, nyau ya dziko la Germany, ikuyendetsa ndi U-boats, ikukumbukira kusintha mwayi uno.

en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
ny: Ngakhale kumene mabungwe akafika, Ujerumani yemweyo anayenera kuchita kudzaza Briteni ngati anachita kudzaza m'malo mwa Ulaya wonse.

en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
ny: Mbuzi zikudziwika kuti zinali zofunikira kuchokera mu mwaka waku 10,000 kumwamba wa Zagros ku Iran.

en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
ny: Makasitikoni a m'maboma a kale ndi mafumu anayamba kukhala nawo kuti asamalire m'makono awo kwa mafuta, nyanda, nyama, ndi mabvuto.

en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
ny: M'manja mwa Chichewa, mbuzi zokhazokha zinali zimakhala zikagwirizana m'mitundu yomwe yinakwera m'mipando kapena mizinda yina yomwe yinakonza, zikakhala zimakonzeka ndi anthu amene amakhala akakamiza mbuzi, amene akhoza kuyenera kuyenda kapena kuyenda m'maiko ake, monga amene ali ndi anthu amene amakhala akakamiza nyama. Mabwalo awa a kugwira ntchito ndiwo amene akupitiliza kuchitira ntchito lero.

en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
ny: Mafuta a wagonway anayambitsidwa mu England m'mwaka wa 16.

en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
ny: Ngati mwayi wa mafuta wapangidwa ndi mafuta a m'manja amodzi, amapereka mphamvu zambiri kwa mphamvu zambiri zomwe zimachitika ndi mphamvu zambiri zomwe zimachitika pa masiku.

en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
ny: Mafupa a kusintha anaperekedwa ndi wokha kuti akhale ndi mizere yomweyi. Koma m'malo motero, anthu anayankhula kuti mizere idzakhala yabwino zedi ngati ikhale ndi mpani wokha pa tsopano.

en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
ny: Izi zinakhala zosiyana, koma zikhoza kupanga zosiyana zambiri pa magalimoto a mabwato a m'maso.

en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
ny: Pakati pake, mizinda yamphini yagwiritsidwa ntchito ndi mizinda yachuma. Mwaka wa 1767, mizinda yachuma yopambana yagwiritsidwa ntchito.

en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
ny: Makolo akwaniritsidwa kuti akhale akupita ndi kuyenda, anthu anayamba kuyenda m'manja mwa zaka ziwiri zilipita ndi kusintha kwa Homo Erectus (kutanthauza munthu wokhala m'manja).

en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
ny: Awo, abale awo, Australopithecus sanawale ndi kudzuka ngati chifukwa cha chitetezo.

en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ny: Makalasi a m'manja amapangidwa ku mafosoli a Australopithecus kuchokera pa 4.2-3.9 miliyoni ya makumi awiri, komanso Sahelanthropus angathe kuyenda pa m'manja kuyambira miliyoni yambiri ya makumi awiri.

en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
ny: Tingathe kusintha kwa mwayi wa kuyenda ndi chikondi kwa mazingira, tingathe kuyang'anira m'malonda a mazingira, ndipo tingathe kuwa anthu amene akuyenera kuti tisunge kusintha kwa mwayi wa m'mawa m'malo moti tisamalize kugwiritsa ntchito zochepa.

en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
ny: Izi ndi zofanana ndi chilolezo chokhudza m'mabuku ambiri. Koma, ngati sitikufuna chilolezo chachikulu, ndipo tifune kuyesa mizizi ya mavuto, ndipo tisakweze.

en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
ny: Ndi wazi kwambiri kuti dziko linali lili ndi zaka zambiri zomwe zinachitika chifukwa cha kuyesera kwa anthu pa zinthu za sayansi ndi teknoloji, ndipo zinthu zinakhala zambiri chifukwa cha anthu okhala ndi anthu ambiri ndi zolakwika kwambiri.

en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
ny: Pambuyo pa kuthandizira ndi Kongeresi mwezi wa July 4, chithandizo chachitseka chomwe chinali ndi mphatso ya President wa Kongeresi John Hancock ndi Secretary Charles Thomson chinali kutumizidwa kuchokera m'ma block amodzi kuchokera ku duka la kuchapira la John Dunlap.

en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
ny: Pa usiku wa kati, zilifanyika nakala kati ya 150 na 200, zinazojulikana kama "Dunlap broadsides".

en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
ny: Mtsogoleri watsopano wa chithandizo unayenera kuchitika ndi John Nixon mu dziko la Independence Hall pa July 8.

en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
ny: Mmodzi anali wokhala kwa George Washington pa July 6, amene anamuyika kwa amayi ake ku New York pa July 9. Nkhani yake yafika London pa August 10.

en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
ny: Ma broadsides a 25 a Dunlap amene amadziwika kuchokera kwa anthu ndi ma copy a chaka chachikulu a dokumenti. Ma copy a chitsanzo chachikulu amene amadziwika amachokera kwa chitsanzo chachikulu.

en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
ny: Ambiri a paleontologist amene ali m'maiko ena pano amachititsa manyazi kuti m'dziko lino kuli dziko lina la dinosaurs limene limasankha ndi kuchokera kwa kale. Tidzawapempha ndi mafuta.

en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
ny: Ambiri sangathe kukhulupirika kuti ndi ntchito zao ngati zidinosauro chifukwa akugwiritsa ntchito zidzukulu ndi kugwira ntchito.

en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
ny: Koma zili zambiri za nkhuku zimakhala zimene zimakhalira ngati nyamadziko.

en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
ny: Awo ali ndi mafuta a m'maso ndi mazina, amalima mafuta, ndipo amalima pa m'maso awo awiri ngati T-Rex.

en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
ny: Zonse zinthu zolongosoka zokhudzana ndi kompyuta zili mu tsogolo ndi zosintha zomwe zimakhala zolongosoka pa ntchito ya zolongosoka zomwe zimakhala zolongosoka pa nambala zosiyanasiyana.

en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
ny: Nambala ya binary yingakhale ndi chifukwa chake chokha cha ziwiri, yaani 0 kapena 1, ndipo nambala izi zikuyenera kuthandizidwa ngati ziwiri za binary - kapena bits, kuti tizitumiza ntchito za kompyuta.

en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
ny: Kusowa kwa mtima kwa ndani sangathe kuchitika chifukwa cha nthawi. Mawu a tsiku, monga kusowa mtima, ndi opanda ntchito chifukwa cha kugwiritsa ntchito pa nthawi yomweyo.

en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
ny: Chilichonse chabwino cha kusintha kwa dzanja la kusowa ndi kusintha kwa chithandizo kapena mafuta a nyumba yomwe amapezeka.

en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
ny: Chitukuko cha Hershey ndi Chase ndi chofunika chachikulu chomwe DNA ndi chithunzi cha malo a chidziwitso.

en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
ny: Hershey ndi Chase anatumiza phages, kapena mavayirasi, kuti aphunzitse DNA yawo m'mbale wa bactiria.

en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.

en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
ny: Nkhondo ndi yabwino 70 km kuchokera kumwamba wokhala ndi 100 km kuchokera kumwamba wokhala.

en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
ny: Ndi wachinsinsi pansi pa maria ndi wachikulu pansi pa mpingo.

en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
ny: Kulibe kuti zingakhale maMaria ambiri pa tsididi yomweyo chifukwa cha chikhalidwe chachikulu. Ili ndi lachilendo kuti mafuta anayamba kusintha mpaka pamakono.

en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
ny: Mawu akuchitiridwa ntchito za kuchitira kuti atsikana kapena kuchita kuti akukhulupirire.

en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
ny: Maphunziro ake amachitira kuti anthu adzakhala ndi zinthu zofunika ndi/ kapena zimene zikufunika zomwe zili m'malo mwa kuyendetsa kwa m'manja ndi kuyendetsa kwa m'manja.

en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
ny: Mafunso awa amakhala akugwiritsa ntchito zinthu zomwe zimawonetsa kuti anthu ena akufuna zinthu zomwe amafuna ndi zinthu zomwe m'makono awo zidzawonetsa kuti akufuna kapena kuti asafune zinthu zina.

en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ny: Ziwiri zofunika zokhazikika ndi Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory ndi Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
ny: Pamaso pa nthawi zonse, zinthu ziwiri zingathe kuyamba pamene abwenzi awo akuyenda ndi kuyambira. Kuyambira m'malo m'malo kumakhala kuyenera kuyambira "m'munthu wamkulu" (kapena amayi).

en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
ny: Meneja wamkulu wamkulu ameneyu amakhala ndi chidwi chokwanira kuti achite zinthu zosiyana, kuchita zinthu zosiyana, kuchita kupereka mafunso, kusintha zinthu zosiyana, ndi kuchita kupereka mawu ake.

en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
ny: Pa tsiku lina la chilengedwe, munthu amapanga zinthu zina zokhazokha ndipo amakhala munthu wosamvetsa amene amafuna kusintha zonse zomwe timu imachita ndipo kuzipangitsa zimenezi zikhale zake.

en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
ny: Pa nthawi zonse, wogwiritsa ntchito ndi wopanda ntchito wosavuta kwambiri pa nthawi zonse kwa timu.

en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
ny: Mawu amenewo akukhala ndi mavuto pakati pa anthu ochokera ku mbuyomu ndi anthu ena a mtsogoleri.

en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
ny: Timu zochokera pa intaneti zikugwirizana ndi malamulo otsogolera ngati timu zina zosiyana, koma kuli zinthu zosiyana.

en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
ny: Amafuna anthu a mabungwe a virtual kuyenera kuyamba kugwira ntchito ngati mphamvu ya kugwiritsa ntchito kwa mabungwe awo a physical amene ali m'malo mwawo.

en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
ny: Iwo amapitirira kupereka chidziwitso chokwanira kuposa anthu a mabungwe a tsopano, chifukwa mabungwe awo amatha kukhala ndi mabungwe awo ambiri monga zikhala zimene zingakhale sizikudziwika ndi anthu a mabungwe awo a m'mudzi.

en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
ny: Kusintha kwa timu yowoneka yoyenera (Larson ndi LaFasto, 1989, p109) ndi chilichonse chachikulu cha timu yowonjezera.

en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
ny: Timu yosatha ndi timu ya kusintha zinthu yomwe zonse mwa anthu akupatsa ripoti. Timu yosatha inayamba zinthu zomwe zonse mwa anthu zidzakhala zosintha.

en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
ny: Chifukwa chiyani mtsogoleri wamakampani angafune kugwira ntchito mtsogolo wokhala wokhala wa kusintha mtsogoleri wamakampani? Cholinga chimodzi cha kugwira ntchito za kusintha mtsogoleri wamakampani ndi kusintha.

en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
ny: Pamene zonse zilipo zimatumikizidwa bwino m'maofesi a maphunziro a chitetezo cha mtsogoleri, kusintha ndi kusintha kwa zinthu zingathe kusintha.

en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
ny: Chifukwa chake, mtsogoleri wa maphunziro akhala akugwirizana kuti adzachite ntchito yabwino kuti adzamanga maphunziro awo kuti adzalangize zinthu zokwanira za mtsogoleri.

en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
ny: Pamaso pa chigwirizano chingachitike kusintha, ulemu wokongola ukufuna kuchita chigwirizano cha kusintha ndi kusintha kwa nkhani zosiyana ndi kusintha kwa chigwirizano chachikulu ndi kusintha kwa kudziwa kwa chigwirizano.

en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
ny: Mwana (2006), amapangitsa kuletsa mwayi wa Continuum kuti utumiki wanthu apitilize kuyendetsa mwayi wokhala ndi mlandu wokhala ndi mwayi wokonzekera.

en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
ny: Zinthu zofunikira za neurobioloji zimakonzekera chithandizo chokhazikika chifukwa cha tsatanetsatane pa ntchito ya kusankha zinthu. Choncho, zimachititsa ntchito dziko la ntchito ya utafiti ndikuyambira zinthu zambiri.

en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
ny: Kukhala ndi chilolezo chokhudzana ndi mawu a mtima ndi kusintha kwa anthu kumapangitsa anthu a science kuwoneka ngati akufunafuna.

en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
ny: Kumakhala kwadziwika kwa nthawi yambiri kuti zinthu zosiyanasiyana za kusowa kwa ubongo, kusowa kwa nthambi, kusowa kwa zinthu, ndi kusowa kwa zinthu zokwanira zimachititsa kuti zikuyenda ndi kusintha mabodza a mawu.

en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
ny: Kuthamanga kwa zinthu zatsopano kumapereka mphamvu kuti tisamve ndi kuchita chitseko pa mafundo ndi zinthu za mtima zomwe sizikudziwika kale.

en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
ny: Izi zitipatsa zambiri zomwezi ndi zofunikira kuti tisunge mafano a kusintha zinthu zomwe zitithandiza kuti tifunetse mafano a kusintha mwa mtima wathu.

en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
ny: Ngati AI ili ndi chikhalidwe chokhazikika cha science fiction, AI ili ndi chigawo chachikulu cha science ya kompyuta, ikugwiritsa ntchito zinthu zofunika zokha, kugwiritsa ntchito ndi kusintha mawu a chisoni mwa makhompyuta.

en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
ny: Kulimbira mwa AI imachitika ndi kugawa zinthu zomwe zikhale zikuchitika ndi chidwi chomwe chikuchitira ntchito yabwino.

en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
ny: Zofunika ndi kusankha, kuchita mipango ndi kugwiritsa ntchito, kugwiritsa ntchito kwa wanthu ndi kusankha mawu, komanso kugwiritsa ntchito mawu, mawu ndi nyimbo.

en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
ny: Zinthu zimenezi zayamba kukhala zinthu zosintha, zomwe zimakhala ndi chidwi chokhudza kuti zikhale ndi mabvuto a m'malo mwa moyo wa anthu.

en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
ny: Mfundo wa AI umakhala ukugwiritsidwa ntchito kwambiri mu ma dziko a ekonomiki, madzi, mafunso ndi mafunso, ndipo umakhala wogwiritsa ntchito mwa zida zambiri za kompyuta ya nyumba ndi zida za mpira wa video.

en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
ny: Ziwalo zokhala m'malo mwa kusankha ndi chidziwitso chokhala m'madziro. Kukhala ndi mphunzitsi wina amapemphera kusankha ana ake kumene kukhala ndi ziwalo zosankha bus sizili bwino.

en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
ny: Mafunso amapereka chilolezo ndi mafunso a m'manja pa njira ya virtual field trips. Akaziwo angakhale akugwira ntchito zokonda muziyenda mu muziyenda, kugwira ntchito mu aquarium, kapena kuyang'anira zikomo zokoma pamodzi ndi mafunso awo.

en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
ny: Kugawana ndi chinthu chokhala pa mtengo ndi njira yabwino yomveka kuti tikhale ndi mtendere wa chinthu ndi kugawana mawu ndi mabvuto ndi makasitomala a tsiku lina ndi njira yabwino yomweyo.

en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
ny: Mwachitsanzo, maphunziro a maphunziro kuchokera ku Bennet School ku North Carolina amachita kubisa wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu wabuukhu w

en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
ny: Mablogu angasinthe kusintha kwa ulere wa mafunso. Pamene ana a mafunso amaphatikizapo kuyambira ndi mafunso awo a blogu ndi zofunikira za kusintha mawu ndi kusintha, kuyambira kusintha kwa anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene amakhala ndi anthu amene

en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
ny: Chifukwa anthu ophunzira ndi anthu otsika kwambiri, mtsogoleri wa blogu amapangira ntchito kuti akhale ndi chitseko chokweza kusintha mawu kuti asakwanitse kukhala ndi chidziwitso.

en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
ny: Pali pamenepo kuganiza "kuti anthu akhale ndi chifundo chambiri pa dziko lapansi." Kuyamikira kuchepetsa mawu a anthu kumapangitsa anthu akhale ndi chisoni ndi chikondi (Toto, 2004).

en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
ny: Kusintha mafoni ndi tsogolo limene likutsimikiza kugwirizana, ndipo likutsimikiza ana kuti asunge kusintha zambiri kuposa tsiku la sukulu la tsopano.

en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
ny: Kugwiritsa ntchito bwino mabulogu "kukhululukira ana kuti akhale ndi kusankha ndi kusankha; poyamba kusankha kwa zinthu za Intaneti, ana akhoza kuchotsa mawu awo mu mawu a ena ndipo kuchita kugwiritsa ntchito mawu awo pa zinthu zina zofunikira (Oravec, 2002).

en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.

en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
ny: Pansi patsogolo ndi Mphamvu za Niagara ndipo kumwera ndi dziko la chidziwitso cha Mphamvu ya Muskoka ndi zina.

en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
ny: Zonsezi ndi zina zambiri zimakhazikitsa Ontario ngati chiyani chomwe anthu ena amakhulupirira kuti ndi chilungamo cha Canada.

en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
ny: Mipando yambiri ku nthawi yowawa ku nthawi yomweyo ndi yochepa kuposa anthu ndi zinthu zina zimakhala zopanda anthu.

en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
ny: Kuti kugwirizana kwa anthu omwe amangochititsa manyazi ambiri: Kumakhala anthu ambiri omwe ndi a African Americans amene amakhala ku US kuposa anthu omwe ndi a Canadian citizens.

en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
ny: Mwambao wa Afrika Wachiche wa Mwambao wa Afrika uko kwa Bahari ya Hindi kando ya mwambao wa mashariki mwa Afrika.

en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
ny: Madagascar ndi dziko lalikulu kwambiri, ndipo ndi dziko lalikulu lomwe lili ndi zinthu zosiyanasiyana pamene zikuchitika ndi zolengedwa.

en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
ny: Zambiri mwa mizinda yoyamba ndi dziko lalikulu, kapena lalikulu ndi Ufaransa, ndi dzuwa lalikulu la m'manja.

en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
ny: A Arabu anagwera Uislamu kwa dziko, ndipo unapita mwa Comoros ndi Mayotte.

en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
ny: Nkhondo ya wachinyamata wa Ulaya ndi ukoloni wabwino wabwino wachokera ku 15th century, pamene wachinyamata wa Portugal Vasco da Gama anafufuza njira ya Cape kuchokera ku Ulaya kuyenda ku India.

en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
ny: M'mwera, dziko lili ndi m'mwera wa Sahel, ndipo m'mwera ndi m'mwera wa m'dziko la Atlantiki.

en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
ny: Amai: Kusankha kwa anthu onse amayi amene akupita kusowa kusankha kuti akuti ali ndi bambo, ngati ali ndi chidziwitso cha kusankha.

en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
ny:

Kuyimba ndikugwira ntchito kuyambira kumanga chigololo (koma osamanga chigololo chokondwa kwambiri).

en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
ny: Amai amayenera kudziwa kuti zinthu zokhazokha za maphunziro zingathe kusintha mawuwo amene amangoti ndi chilungamo, ndipo ndi chilungamo kuti zikhale zokhazokha kusintha, kugwirizana ndi kugwirizana ndi zina.

en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
ny: Limba ndi kumanga amuna, ndipo musakhale ndi nthawi yokhala ndi mawu anu (zofanana ndi malamulo a m'maboma kapena ayi, sizikuyenera kukhala bwino!).

en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
ny: Mzinda wamoderni wa Casablanca anapangidwa ndi akapolo a Berber m'mwaka wa 10 BCE, ndipo anapitilizidwa ndi akapolo a Phoenicia, Romans, ndi Merenids kuti apiteko m'mzinda wamakono wapamwamba wochokera ku Anfa.

en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
